alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 1:50PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL MORA COUNTY THROUGH 215 PM MDT... At 148 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a couple of strong thunderstorms near Ojo Felize: one 9 miles east of Mora, and one 13 miles south of Ocate, moving northwest under 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ocate, Golondrinas, Luceros, Ojo Feliz, Rainsville and El Turquillo. This includes State Road 434 between Mile Markers 5 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands
